intro: Astracantha leiophylla, commonly known as the smooth-leaved spurge, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant features succulent, smooth, and fleshy leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often clustered in cyathia, which are modified inflorescences typical of the spurge family. Astracantha leiophylla is adapted to arid environments, making it a resilient species in dry, rocky habitats.
